diff_hunk:
@@ -119,7 +118,7 @@ class Conv1d(_ConvNd):
          In other words, for an input of size :math:`(N, C_{in}, L_{in})`, if you want a
          depthwise convolution with a depthwise multiplier `K`,
          then you use the constructor arguments
-         :math:`(\text{in_channels}=C_{in}, \text{out_channels}=C_{in} * K, ..., \text{groups}=C_{in})`
+         :math:`(in\_channels=C_{in}, out\_channels=C_{in} * K, ..., groups=C_{in})`
body:
I agree with @fmassa . Please keep the `\text`. The purpose here is to make it read nice. Readability is prioritized over code tidiness here.

Also from playing on https://khan.github.io/KaTeX/, I don't seem to need to escape `\` after `\prod(`
